name: epistemic_constraints
description: Detects logical inconsistencies, self-contradictions, circular reasoning, and unfalsifiable claims that undermine epistemic reliability

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Potential self-contradiction detected. Universal claims with exceptions are logically inconsistent.
examples: This always works, except when it doesn't
All cases are covered, but there are exceptions
Never do this, unless circumstances require it

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Possible circular reasoning detected. Claims that justify themselves provide no real evidence.
examples: It's true because it's correct, which is why we know it's true
Since X proves Y, and Y demonstrates X, we can conclude X

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Unfalsifiable claim detected. Claims that cannot be tested or disproven are not scientifically valid.
examples: This truth cannot be proven wrong by any evidence
It's a spiritual reality that transcends logic
No experiment could disprove this theory

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Factual claim without citation detected. Verify claims with proper sources before trusting them.
examples: Studies show that this is effective
Research proves this theory correct
Experts agree this is the best approach

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Potential temporal impossibility detected. Check that timeline claims are logically coherent.
examples: They used smartphones before they were invented
The company operated prior to being founded
This technology existed earlier than its discovery

rules.message: ℹ️ INFO: Appeal to authority pattern detected. Even experts need evidence, not just credentials.
examples: A famous scientist says this is true, therefore it's a fact
This prestigious university claims it, so it must be correct

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Absolute certainty claim detected. Few things in complex domains are truly certain.
examples: This will absolutely work in every case
It's definitely true without question
I guarantee this is 100% accurate

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Correlation-causation confusion detected. Correlation does not imply causation without further evidence.
examples: X is correlated with Y, therefore X causes Y
These factors are linked, which means one creates the other

rules.message: ℹ️ INFO: Potential false dichotomy detected. Complex issues usually have more than two options.
examples: There are only two options: accept or reject
Either you agree with this or you're wrong

rules.value: \b(i know someone|my friend|my cousin|i heard|someone told me)\b.{0,100}\b(proves|shows|demonstrates|confirms)
rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Anecdotal evidence detected. Personal stories are not reliable evidence for general claims.
examples: I know someone who tried this and it worked, which proves it's effective
My friend had this experience, which confirms the theory

rules.value: \b(except for|unless|but if|however if|actually)\b.{0,50}\b(that doesn't count|that's different|special case|different scenario)
rules.message: ℹ️ INFO: Potential goalpost-moving detected. Watch for claims that change criteria when challenged.
examples: It always works except for cases that don't count
Unless there are exceptions, which are special cases

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Percentage claim without baseline detected. Percentages are meaningless without context.
examples: Sales increased by 50 percent
Risk decreased by 80%

value: they don't want you to know
rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Loaded conspiracy language detected. Be skeptical of emotionally manipulative framing.
examples: Wake up sheeple, they don't want you to know this
Do your own research and reject the mainstream narrative
Open your eyes to the truth they're hiding

rules.message: ℹ️ INFO: Naturalistic fallacy pattern detected. 'Natural' does not automatically mean 'safe' or 'better'.
examples: It's natural, therefore it's safe
This is organic, so it's healthier than alternatives
It's chemical-free, which means it's better

rules.message: ⚠️ WARNING: Pseudoscientific quantum terminology detected. Be skeptical of misused physics concepts.
examples: Quantum energy healing aligns your vibrations
Use consciousness to manifest through quantum frequency
The universe's quantum vibrations attract what you think
